ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write creative essays.
This course drastically improved my writing. I learned to produce well-structured, concise essays.
In the course we focused on 5 different types of essays. It was helpful to receive classmate and professor feedback.

I definitely have improved my creative writing skills by taking this course. Writing an essay on five topics (Personal, Place, Person, Cultural Criticism, and Humor) made me realize that there are many ways to approach creative writing and this class taught me that.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not too much of a time commitment, but some nights had too many long readings.

Strengths: The readings from this course added a lot of depth for the course especially with diverse authors. I also liked the coming up with a topic, drafting, and editing schedule that we had. It helped me stay on track. Workshopping during class was also useful.
Weaknesses: None.

The strengths are the personal and constructive comments on drafts and final essays. 
I personally did not enjoy the last unit, humor, and believe it could be replaced with a better subject.

strengths: classmate feedback on essays, feedback from professor, multiple drafts for each essay
weaknesses: some of the readings did not resemble the essay that we would be writing very well, making it difficult to learn about the techniques of that essay, during class discussion it was normally a few people who dominated the discussion

The structure of this course was really well done and I was able to keep up for most of it. The professor I had was extremely good at keeping the class conversations afloat and would always give us amazing feedback during workshops. It is a well-rounded class that I don't see any weaknesses for.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I highly recommend this course to anyone looking for a writing credit!

Yes! This class was incredibly fun to take and while it may depend on the section that you are in, if you get a good professor and classmates that are easy to get along with, you will have a great time.
Yes, I would. It was a great writing course.
Absolutely!! Your writing will become so much better.
I would recommend this to anyone who wants to improve their writing skills. There was very clear feedback for each essay.
Yes!!! A hundred percent yes!! This course is THE course that I'll be telling students about because it really did improve my writing tenfold.
